discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Ref 19.4.2
The project plan is updated to incorporate actual progress from the management stage that is finishing, and to include forecast duration and costs from the exception plan or stage plan for the management stage about to begin.

Creating time and cost tolerances for the delivery of the magazine advertisements [A] is not relevant to this activity, as tolerances are set during the 'create the project plan' activity. Creating the product description, with detailed quality criteria, for the magazine advertisements [B] is not relevant to this activity, as the product description is created during the 'create the project plan' activity. Recording changes to ABC Company risk appetite as a result of using the magazine advertisements [D] is not relevant to this activity, as changes to risk appetite are recorded during the 'update the risk register' activity. Therefore, the appropriate action for the project manager during the 'update the project plan' activity is to record the effect of implementing the magazine advertisements on the overall time and cost of the project.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Page 21.
The goal is to seek opportunities to implement improvements during the life of the project

B is the correct answer.

Yes, because opportunities to improve should be recorded and acted upon.

In PRINCE2, the 'learn from experience' principle encourages capturing lessons that can be used to improve performance on future work.

Here, the project manager has learned from others' experience to identify enhancements for the training materials that could avoid delays. Documenting these opportunities to apply the lessons is appropriate.

A is incorrect as this is about improvement rather than risk management.

C is incorrect as lessons learned are useful even if from outside organizations.

D is incorrect as the business case is not being updated here.
